p: Invasive species are defined as those non-native species that threaten habitats and thus damage the structure and function of both terrestrial and aquatic ecosystems ( Pejchar and Mooney, 2009, Keller et al., 2011). Invasive species are considered fundamental causes of reduction in native species abundance and contributing to biodiversity loss and damage of ecosystem services in various environments ( Didham et al., 2005, Shochat et al., 2010, Duenas et al., 2018, Linders et al., 2019). Subsequently, the invasive species lead to community changes and ecosystem-level shifts, so they are an increasing challenge worldwide for the management of biodiversity and ecosystem functioning ( Brooks et al., 2004).
